title: Diamond as Big as the Ritz - Chicago princess

content.question: The narrator’s hypothetical example of “a Chicago beef-princess” in the second sentence of the second paragraph mainly serves to

choices.label: describe a stranger’s experience when visiting Hades
introduce a character with whom John becomes acquainted
convey the townspeople’s anxiousness to impress city dwellers
mock the townspeople’s efforts to appear sophisticated

content.answer: mock the townspeople’s efforts to appear sophisticated

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the function of setting in a narrative.
